intro: Galedupa cochinchinensis, commonly known as the Vietnamese star anise, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Lauraceae and is characterized by its aromatic, star-shaped fruits that resemble those of the star anise. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and has compound leaves with a rough texture. Its flowers are small and green, often clustered in dense inflorescences. The fruit develops from the flower and is harvested when fully mature for its essential oils and medicinal properties.
